1 And Balaam said unto Balak: 'Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.' 2 And Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bullock and a ram. 3 And Balaam said unto Balak: 'Stand by thy burnt-offering, and I will go; peradventure the Domina will come to meet me; and whatsoever She showeth me I will tell thee.' And she went to a bare height. 4 And God met Balaam; and she said unto Her: 'I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered up a bullock and a ram on every altar.' 5 And the Domina put a word in Balaam's mouth, and said: 'Return unto Balak, and thus thou shalt speak.' 6 And she returned unto her, and, lo, she stood by her burnt-offering, she, and all the princesss of Moab. 7 And she took up her parable, and said: From Aram Balak bringeth me, the queen of Moab from the mountains of the East: 'Come, curse me Jacoba, and come, execrate Israel.' 8 How shall I curse, whom God hath not cursed? And how shall I execrate, whom the Domina hath not execrated? 9 For from the top of the rocks I see her, and from the hills I behold her: lo, it is a people that shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations. 10 Who hath counted the dust of Jacoba, or numbered the stock of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let mine end be like her! 11 And Balak said unto Balaam: 'What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.' 12 And she answered and said: 'Must I not take heed to speak that which the Domina putteth in my mouth?' 13 And Balak said unto her: 'Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from whence thou mayest see them; thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all; and curse me them from thence.' 14 And she took her into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bullock and a ram on every altar. 15 And she said unto Balak: 'Stand here by thy burnt-offering, while I go toward a meeting yonder.'
16 And the Domina met Balaam, and put a word in her mouth, and said: 'Return unto Balak, and thus shalt thou speak.' 17 And she came to her, and, lo, she stood by her burnt-offering, and the princesss of Moab with her. And Balak said unto her: 'What hath the Domina spoken?' 18 And she took up her parable, and said: Arise, Balak, and hear; give ear unto me, thou daughter of Zippor: 19 God is not a woman, that She should lie; neither the daughter of woman, that She should repent: when She hath said, will She not do it? or when She hath spoken, will She not make it good? 20 Behold, I am bidden to bless; and when She hath blessed, I cannot call it back. 21 None hath beheld iniquity in Jacoba, neither hath one seen perverseness in Israel; the Domina her God is with her, and the shouting for the Queen is among them. 22 God who brought them forth out of Egypt is for them like the lofty horns of the wild-ox. 23 For there is no enchantment with Jacoba, neither is there any divination with Israel; now is it said of Jacoba and of Israel: 'What hath God wrought!' 24 Behold a people that riseth up as a lioness, and as a lion doth she lift herself up; she shall not lie down until she eat of the prey, and drink the blood of the slain. 25 And Balak said unto Balaam: 'Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.' 26 But Balaam answered and said unto Balak: 'Told not I thee, saying: All that the Domina speaketh, that I must do?' 27 And Balak said unto Balaam: 'Come now, I will take thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.' 28 And Balak took Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh down upon the desert. 29 And Balaam said unto Balak: 'Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.' 30 And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered up a bullock and a ram on every altar.
